lines.content: Welcome to Duke, the leading Command-line Interface to keep track of your tasks!!
Duke runs on CLI commands, and the command instructions will be listed below. Users should follow this format,
replacing the square bracket segments (eg. **[description], [deadline], [place], [index]**) with the relevant information.
**1. Add a todo task to the TasksList**
**2. Add a deadline task to the TasksList**
**3. Add an event task to the TasksList**
**4. List out all tasks in TasksList**
**5. Delete the task in index [index] of TasksList**
**6. Mark the task in index [index] of TasksList as completed**
**7. Unmark the task in index [index] of TasksList to make it uncompleted**
**8. List all tasks that match the searchPhrase **
* Parses the input to create Commands
* @throws DukeUnknownInputException Exception if user command does not match any built in commands
public static Command parse(String input) throws DukeUnknownInputException {
private static final String root = System.getProperty("user.dir");
private static final Path filePath = Paths.get(root, "data", "duke.txt");
private static final Path dirPath = Paths.get(root, "data");
* @throws DukeIOException Exception thrown when IO Exception occurs
* Loads Tasks from Storage into Duke
* @throws DukeFileNotFoundException if the File is not found
* @throws DukeIOException thrown when IO Exception occurs
public void writeToFile(TaskList tasks) throws DukeIOException {
public static final String helpGuide = "Here are some commands to start off:\n"
+ "  todo ____              to create a todo task\n"
+ "  deadline ____ /by ___  to create a deadline task\n"
+ "  event ____ /at ___     to create an event task\n"
+ "  bye                    to end the Duke Application\n";
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Duke\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Prints message when Task is added to Tasks
* @param t The Task added to Tasks
public void addTaskMessage(ArrayList<Task> tasks, Task t) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: \n  " + t);
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list\n");
* Prints message when Task is deleted from Tasks
* @param taskInt the index of Task to be removed
public void deleteTaskMessage(ArrayList<Task> tasks, int taskInt) {
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task: \n  " + tasks.get(taskInt));
System.out.println("Now you have " + remainingTasks + " tasks in the list\n");
* Lists out all the tasks in Tasks
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Prints Message when a Task is marked as done
* @param markedNum Index of Task to be marked
public void markTaskMessage(ArrayList<Task> tasks, int markedNum) {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
* Prints Message when a Task is unmarked
* @param unmarkedNum Index of Task that needs to be unmarked
public void unmarkTaskMessage(ArrayList<Task> tasks, int unmarkedNum) {
System.out.println("Oh no :( I've marked it as uncompleted: ");

* Prints the Goodbye Message when Duke is terminated.
